question.title: Why is my project controller doesn't see my templates views?
question.body:
I started new project with spring boot starter web and ran into a problem.

package com.example.project2;

import org.springframework.stereotype.Controller;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;

@Controller
@RequestMapping("/test")
public class Controller2 {

    @GetMapping
    public String indexForExample() {
        return "index";
    }
}

index - are the file in templates directory. I double check my ways in project.

All seems clear and fine.

But as soon as I started, spring ( or maybe other thing ) cant find my views.
enter image description here
enter image description here

Controller in package

package com.example.project2;

application properties -

spring.application.name=project2

answers.body:
Your method must have @ResponseBody and you MUST also set the correct content type Without it, browsers may display a blank page or show the raw HTML
Return a ResponseEntity<Resource> instead.

@Controller
@RequestMapping("/test")
public class Controller2 {

    @GetMapping
    @ResponseBody
    public ResponseEntity<Resource> indexForExample() {
        Resource resource = new ClassPathResource("templates/index.html");

        return ResponseEntity
                .ok()
                .header("Content-Type", "text/html")
                .body(resource);
    }
}

and then you should call this http://localhost:9230/test

that should be work

question_comments.body: Oh, I didn't notice the reply. Thank you! Its seems to work

Server have to return a view ( templates views ) when navigating to a specific path on the local host of the machine. I can actually do this by simply converting files to an intup stream and passing them to methods ( using RestController ) But that doesn't seem right somehow?
